p: Fleagrass is an important and useful aromatic plant with a distinct aroma. The main chemical constituents of the essential oil are terpenoids, which have distinct odours and bioactivities. We selected 23 compounds that have biological activities that are related to the ethnobotanical uses of fleagrass, as shown in Table 2. Thymol, carvacrol, 3-carene, p-cymene, β-phellandrene, α-phellandrene, cuminic acid, β-bisabolene, α-pinene, and limonene are the main constituents of the essential oil of fleagrass. The bioactivities of these constituents can be divided into six categories: antimicrobial, sterilization, insecticidal, insect repellent, anti-inflammatory, and anti-viral.
